name: SCOR SPARTA Techniques
description: SPARTA Techniques cluster derived from Aerospace Corporationâ€™s SPARTA STIX feed. Provides structured space threat technique taxonomy mapped to SPARTA tactics.

values.description: Adversary collects publicly available or signal-based information about space systems, ground stations, or mission elements to prepare operations.
Enumerating mission components, infrastructure, or space assets to identify weak points in communications, telemetry, or control planes.
Compromise or manipulation of suppliers, integrators, or logistics pathways for space system components prior to deployment.
Targeting and breaching ground infrastructure supporting space assets, including TT&C facilities, to enable command manipulation or denial of service.
Using a co-orbital or inspector satellite to approach, collect data from, or disrupt a target satellite in orbit.
Interfering with TT&C, payload, or navigation links through targeted jamming of RF or optical channels.
Crafting and transmitting malicious or spoofed signals to deceive space or ground segment systems, often mimicking trusted command paths.
Taking unauthorized control of a satellite payload to disrupt mission or re-task the asset for adversarial objectives.
Establishing a persistent or covert command-and-control channel to control compromised space or ground assets.
Extracting telemetry or payload data covertly or overtly to degrade confidentiality or enable follow-on operations.
Deliberately causing mission degradation or loss of service availability through cyber or physical attack vectors.
